title: Monocacy National Battlefield: Operating Hours & Seasons
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information     Operating Hours & Seasons              Operating Hours & Seasons         Visitor Center Entrance Sign NPS  Monocacy National Battlefield Hours Park: 7:00 a.m. to 20 minutes following sunset Visitor Center:  9:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. Physical Address (GPS): 5201 Urbana Pike, Frederick, Maryland 21704 Mailing Address: 4632 Araby Church Road, Frederick, Maryland 21704 Monocacy National Battlefield is closed Thanksgiving Day, Christmas Day, and New Year's Day. Ranger Programs Monocacy National Battlefield's ranger programs are seasonal and are available daily between May 30 to September 5.  Battle Orientation programs are 30-45 minute introductions to the Battle of Monocacy.  Ranger Hikes will take place on the Junction Trail or the Gambrill Mill Trail.  Maximum distance for Ranger Hikes is up to one mile an may take 45-60 minutes to complete.  Hands-on-History programs are 45-60 minute activities that require visitor participation.  Activities may include Mock Artillery or Infantry Drill, and handling museum artifacts.  The daily ranger schedule is as follows:  Monday - Friday - Meet in the Visitor Center Lobby. 11:00 a.m. | Battle Orientation  2:00 p.m. | Battle Orientation Saturday & Sunday - Meet in the Visitor Center Lobby. 11:00 a.m. | Ranger Hike (1 mile) 1:00 p.m. | Hands-on-History (Activity - requires physical participation) 3:00 p.m. | Battle Orientation
